00031 #include <stdio.h>
00032 #include <stdlib.h>
00033 #include <string.h>
00034 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00035 #include <sys/types.h>
00036 #include <sys/stat.h>
00037 #include <fcntl.h>
00038 #include <errno.h>
00039 #include <unistd.h>
00040 #include <getopt.h>
00041 
00042 #ifndef HAVE_FIEMAP
00043 # include <linux/types.h>
00044 # include <linux/fiemap.h>
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 #ifndef FS_IOC_FIEMAP
00048 # define FS_IOC_FIEMAP (_IOWR('f', 11, struct fiemap))
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 #define ONEMB 1048576
00052 
00053 /* This test executes fiemap ioctl and check
00054  * a) there are no file ranges marked with FIEMAP_EXTENT_UNWRITTEN
00055  * b) data ranges sizes sum is equal to given in second param */
00056 int check_fiemap(int fd, long long orig_size)
00057 {
00058         /* This buffer is enougth for 1MB length file */
00059         union { struct fiemap f; char c[4096]; } fiemap_buf;
00060         struct fiemap *fiemap = &fiemap_buf.f;
00061         struct fiemap_extent *fm_extents = &fiemap->fm_extents[0];
00062         unsigned int count = (sizeof(fiemap_buf) - sizeof(*fiemap)) /
00063                         sizeof(*fm_extents);
00064         unsigned int i = 0;
00065         long long file_size = 0;
00066 
00067         memset(&fiemap_buf, 0, sizeof(fiemap_buf));
00068 
00069         fiemap->fm_start = 0;
00070         fiemap->fm_flags = FIEMAP_FLAG_SYNC;
00071         fiemap->fm_extent_count = count;
00072         fiemap->fm_length = FIEMAP_MAX_OFFSET;
00073 
00074         if (ioctl(fd, FS_IOC_FIEMAP, fiemap) < 0) {
00075                 fprintf(stderr, "error while ioctl %i\n",  errno);
00076                 return -1;
00077         }
00078 
00079         for (i = 0; i < fiemap->fm_mapped_extents; i++) {
00080                 printf("extent in "
00081                         "offset %lu, length %lu\n"
00082                         "flags: %x\n",
00083                         (unsigned long)fm_extents[i].fe_logical,
00084                         (unsigned long)fm_extents[i].fe_length,
00085                         fm_extents[i].fe_flags);
00086 
00087                 if (fm_extents[i].fe_flags & FIEMAP_EXTENT_UNWRITTEN) {
00088                         fprintf(stderr, "Unwritten extent\n");
00089                         return -2;
00090                 } else {
00091                         file_size += fm_extents[i].fe_length;
00092                 }
00093         }
00094 
00095         printf("No unwritten extents, extents number %u, "
00096                 "file size %lli, original size %lli\n",
00097                 fiemap->fm_mapped_extents,
00098                 file_size, orig_size);
00099         return file_size != orig_size;
00100 }
00101 
00102 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00103 {
00104         int c;
00105         struct option long_opts[] = {
00106                 {"test", no_argument, 0, 't'},
00107                 {NULL, 0, NULL, 0}
00108         };
00109         int fd;
00110         int rc;
00111 
00112         optind = 0;
00113         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "t", long_opts, NULL)) != -1) {
00114                 switch (c) {
00115                 case 't':
00116                         return 0;
00117                 default:
00118                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' unrecognized\n",
00119                                 argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
00120                 return -1;
00121                 }
00122         }
00123 
00124         if (optind != argc - 2) {
00125                 fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s <filename> <filesize>\n", argv[0]);
00126                 return -1;
00127         }
00128 
00129         fd = open(argv[optind], O_RDONLY);
00130         if (fd < 0) {
00131                 fprintf(stderr, "cannot open %s for reading, error %i",
00132                         argv[optind], errno);
00133                 return -1;
00134         }
00135 
00136         fprintf(stderr, "fd: %i\n", fd);
00137 
00138         rc = check_fiemap(fd, atoll(argv[optind + 1]));
00139 
00140         if (close(fd) < 0)
00141                 fprintf(stderr, "closing %s, error %i", argv[optind], errno);
00142 
00143         return rc;
00144 }
